content.description: This is a straightforward problem on good crimps.
content.location: Next to the corner at the far right end of the rock band, SDS using a pair of opposing sidepulls and climb the short vertical face on crimps.

content.description: This climbs the overhanging prow located at the right end of the rock band. Though it’s relatively short, from the standpoint of rock quality and creativity of movement this problem is one of the very best in the canyon.
content.location: SDS beneath the overhang using small pockets on either side of the prow then climb out and up. There are probably numerous sequences using compression and pockets that could be improvised.

content.description: This is a vertical problem climbing the tallest part of the wall on great holds. The topout is fairly high but solid.
content.location: Directly under a slight dome marking the tallest part of the wall, start with your jugs of choice and climb straight up on pockets.

content.description: This is an approx. 50 foot long wall of mostly vertical, good quality rock located at the top of the west side of the canyon. In addition to the problems described there are many unnamed V0 type lines.
